name: Constantine the Great
what_did:
Constantine became the first Roman emperor to become a Christian.
He made it legal to follow Christianity and helped it grow across the empire.
He also built a new city, Constantinople, which became very important.
why_matters:
Constantine changed history by helping Christianity spread and survive.
His city, Constantinople, lasted for over 1,000 years.
He showed how one leader can shape religion and culture.
